</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	PART III
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>
<A NAME="FIS_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228031Z10-K_HTM_FK12301_ITEM_10__DIRECTORS,_EXECUTIVE___ITE02317">
</A>
<A NAME="A2228031Z10-K_HTM_TOC_FK12301_4">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Directors, Executive Officers and Corporate Governance.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There are no directors or executive officers of the Registrant. The Trustee is a corporate trustee which may be removed by the
	affirmative vote of the holders of a majority of the outstanding units at a meeting of the holders of units of beneficial interest of the Trust at which a quorum is present.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Trust does not have a principal executive officer, principal financial officer, principal accounting officer or controller and, therefore, has not adopted a code of ethics applicable
	to such persons. However, employees of the Trustee must comply with the bank's code of ethics.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Trust does not have a board of directors, and therefore does not have an audit committee, an audit committee financial expert, or a nominating committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Section&nbsp;16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Trust has no directors or officers. Accordingly, only holders of more than 10% of the Trust's units are required to file with the
	SEC initial reports of ownership of Units and reports of changes in such ownership pursuant to Section&nbsp;16 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. Based solely on a review of these reports,
	the Trust believes that the applicable reporting requirements of Section&nbsp;16(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 were complied with for all transactions that occurred in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Audit
	fees consist of fees for the audit of the Mesa Royalty Trust financial statements and reimbursement for travel-related expenses related to the audit
	and quarterly reviews for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014. The Mesa Royalty Trust is reimbursed by the working interest owners for approximately 88.56% of general
	and administrative expenses incurred.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Tax
	fees consist of fees related to the Mesa Royalty Trust's tax information for its unitholders related to work performed on the taxes, returns and other
	items billed during 2015 and 2014. The Mesa Royalty Trust is reimbursed by the working interest owners for approximately 88.56% of general and administrative expenses incurred.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>

<FONT SIZE=2>

<EFX_EXHIBIT_31>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_31"></A>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3>
<A HREF="#A2228031ZEX-31_HTM_15ZCW12301_2">
	QuickLinks
</A>
</FONT>

</FONT>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228031ZEX-31_HTM_KA12301_EXHIBIT_31">
</A>
<A NAME="A2228031ZEX-31_HTM_TOC_KA12301_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Exhibit&nbsp;31
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228031ZEX-31_HTM_KA12301_CERTIFICATION">
</A>
<A NAME="A2228031ZEX-31_HTM_TOC_KA12301_2">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	CERTIFICATION
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Each
	of the undersigned, Elaina Conley and Michael&nbsp;J. Ulrich, certifies that:
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	1.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	I
	have reviewed this annual report on Form&nbsp;10-K of Mesa Royalty Trust, for which The Bank of New York Mellon Trust Company, N.A. acts as Trustee;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Based
	on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements
	made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	3.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Based
	on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the
	financial condition, distributable income and changes in trust corpus of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	4.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	I
	am responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15 (e)&nbsp;and 15d-
	15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(c) and 15d-15 (f)), or for causing such controls and procedures to be established and maintained,
	for the registrant and I have:
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Designed
	such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under my supervision, to ensure that
	material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to me by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is
	being prepared;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Designed
	such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under my supervision, to
	provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with the basis of accounting described in
	Note&nbsp;3;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(c)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Evaluated
	the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report my conclusions about the effectiveness of
	the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(d)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Disclosed
	in this report any change in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most recent fiscal
	quarter (the registrant's fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant's internal control over
	financial reporting; and
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	5.
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	I
	have disclosed, based on my most recent evaluation, to the registrant's auditors:
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	All
	significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting, which are reasonably likely to
	adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, process, summarize and report information; and
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(b)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Any
	fraud, whether or not material, that involves any persons who have a significant role in the registrant's internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
</DL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2228031",CP="MESA ROYALTY TRUST",DN="2",CHK=185875,FOLIO='BLANK',FILE='DISK125:[15ZCW1.15ZCW12301]KA12301A.;6',USER='CHE105542',CD='29-MAR-2016;21:14' -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	giving the foregoing certifications in paragraphs&nbsp;4 and 5, I have relied to the extent I consider reasonable on information provided to me by the working interest owners.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>

</TD>

<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

</FONT>
</TD>

	/s/&nbsp;MICHAEL J. ULRICH
<BR>
<HR NOSHADE SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="100%" COLOR="#000000">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	March&nbsp;30,
	2016
<BR>
	Via EDGAR
<BR>
	Securities and Exchange Commission
<BR>
	Judiciary Plaza
<BR>
	450 Fifth Street, N.W.
<BR>
	Washington, D.C. 20549
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Re:
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Certification
	pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Ladies
	and Gentlemen:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	connection with the Annual Report of Mesa Royalty Trust (the "Trust") on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as filed with the Securities and Exchange
	Commission on the date hereof (the "Report"), the undersigned, not in his or her individual capacity but solely as the trustee of the
	Trust, certifies pursuant to 18 U.S.C. 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that to his or her knowledge:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	Report fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended; and
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	information contained in the Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Trust.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	above certification is furnished solely pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 (18 U.S.C. 1350) and is not being filed as part of the Form&nbsp;10-K or as
	a separate disclosure document.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>

</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	February&nbsp;22, 2016
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Mesa Royalty Trust
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	919 Congress Avenue
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Suite&nbsp;500
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Austin, Texas 78701
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Ladies and Gentlemen:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Pursuant to your request, we have prepared estimates of the extent and value of the proved gas reserves and associated condensate and natural gas liquids (NGL) reserves, as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, attributable to an overriding royalty interest (the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	ORRI)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	that the Mesa Royalty Trust (the Trust) has represented that it owns. The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	ORRI
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	was conveyed to the Trust pursuant to an Overriding Royalty Conveyance dated November&nbsp;1, 1979 (the Conveyance), and is payable out of certain &#147;net proceeds&#148; attributable to the grantor&#146;s ownership of certain oil and gas properties located in the San Juan Basin of Colorado and New Mexico and the Hugoton field in Kansas. The grantor&#146;s interests in the oil and gas properties (referred to as the &#147;Subject Interests&#148; in the Conveyance and evaluated in this report) are now owned and/or administered by BP America Production Company (BP), ConocoPhilips (Conoco), Red Willow Production Company (Red Willow), XTO Energy Inc. (XTO), and Linn Energy, LLC (Linn). BP, Conoco, Red Willow, XTO, and Linn are collectively referred to as the &#147;Lessees.&#148; This report was prepared at the request of The Bank of New York Trust Company, N.A. (Bank of New York), the trustee of the Trust. This evaluation was completed on February&nbsp;21, 2016. The Trust has represented that these properties account for 100 percent on a net equivalent barrel basis of the Trust&#146;s net proved reserves as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. The net proved reserves estimates prepared by us have been prepared in accordance with the reserves definitions of Rules&nbsp;4&#150;10(a)&nbsp;(1)&#150;(32) of Regulation S&#150;X of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). This report was prepared in accordance with guidelines specified in Item 1202(a)(8)&nbsp;of Regulation S-K and is to be used for inclusion in certain SEC filings by the Trust.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2228031",CP="MESA ROYALTY TRUST",DN="4",CHK=642100,FOLIO='',FILE="DISK104:[15ZCW2.15ZCW12302]23223-2-MM_ZCW12302.CHC",USER="JMCGUAN",CD='MAR 29 15:44 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.5PT;">
	2
</FONT>
<A NAME="A2228031ZEX-99_1_HTM_23223-2-MM_PB_2_092441_660">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="ARIAL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:5.0PT;">
	DEGOLYER AND MACNAUGHTON
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Reserves estimated in this report are expressed as net reserves. Gross reserves are defined as the total estimated gas, condensate, and NGL to be produced from, and net to, the Subject Interests (inclusive of the ORRI) after December 31, 2015. Net reserves are defined as that portion of the gross reserves attributable to the Trust&#146;s ownership of the ORRI.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	While estimates of reserves attributable to the Trust&#146;s ownership of the ORRI are shown in order to comply with requirements of the SEC, this is no precise method of allocating estimates of physical quantities of reserves between the working interest owners (the Lessees) and the Trust. The ORRI is not a working interest and the Trust does not own, and is not entitled to receive by virtue of its ownership of the ORRI, any specific quantity of reserves from these oil and gas properties. Reserves quantities in this report have been allocated based on the method referenced under the Methodology and Procedures heading of this letter report. The quantities of reserves attributable to the Trust&#146;s ORRI will be affected by future changes in various economic factors utilized in estimating future gross and net revenues from the Subject Interests. Therefore, the estimates of reserves set forth in this reserves report are to a large extent hypothetical and differ in significant respects from estimates of reserves attributable to a working interest.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	This report presents values that were estimated for proved reserves using initial prices and costs provided by Bank of New York on behalf of the Lessees for the properties administered by each. A detailed explanation of the price and cost assumptions used herein is included under the Primary Economic Assumptions header of this letter report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Values associated with the ORRI and the Subject Interests are expressed in terms of estimated future net proceeds, future net revenue, and present worth. Future gross revenue is that revenue which will accrue from the sale of gas, condensate, and NGL reserves net to the Subject Interests. Future net proceeds attributable to the Subject Interests are calculated by deducting production taxes and certain production costs from the estimated future gross revenue. The future net revenue attributable to the ORRI is calculated by multiplying the net proceeds attributable to the Subject Interests by the Trust&#146;s ownership of the ORRI. The Trust&#146;s ownership of the ORRI is 11.4429 percent of 90 percent of the future net proceeds. Future income tax expenses were not taken into account in the preparation of these estimates. Present worth is defined as future net revenue discounted at a specified arbitrary discount rate compounded monthly over the expected period of realization. Present worth should not be construed as fair market
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.5PT;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2">
<A NAME="A2228031ZEX-99_1_HTM_23223-2-MM_PB_3_092505_7056">
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.5PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="ARIAL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:5.0PT;">
	DEGOLYER AND MACNAUGHTON
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	value because no consideration was given to additional factors that influence the prices at which properties are bought and sold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Estimates of condensate, NGL, and gas reserves and future net revenue should be regarded only as estimates that may change as further production history and additional information become available. Not only are such reserves and revenue estimates based on that information which is currently available, but such estimates are also subject to the uncertainties inherent in the application of judgmental factors in interpreting such information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Data used in this audit were obtained from reviews with the trustee, from files provided by the trustee, from records on file with the appropriate regulatory agencies, and from public sources. Additionally, this information includes data supplied by IHS Global Inc; Copyright 2015 IHS Global Inc. In the preparation of this report we have relied, without independent verification, upon such information furnished by the trustee with respect to property interests, production from such properties, current costs of operation and development, current prices for production, agreements relating to current and future operations and sale of production, and various other information and data that were accepted as represented. A field examination of the properties was not considered necessary for the purposes of this report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Methodology and Procedures
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Estimates of reserves were prepared by the use of appropriate geologic, petroleum engineering, and evaluation principles and techniques that are in accordance with practices generally recognized by the petroleum industry as presented in the publication of the Society of Petroleum Engineers entitled &#147;Standards Pertaining to the Estimating and Auditing of Oil and Gas Reserves Information (Revision as of February&nbsp;19, 2007).&#148; The method or combination of methods used in the analysis of each reservoir was tempered by experience with similar reservoirs, stage of development, quality and completeness of basic data, and production history.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Based on the current stage of field development, production performance, the development plans provided by the Trust, and the analyses of areas offsetting existing wells with test or production data, reserves were classified as proved.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=3,EFW="2228031",CP="MESA ROYALTY TRUST",DN="4",CHK=389083,FOLIO='3',FILE="DISK104:[15ZCW2.15ZCW12302]23223-2-MM_ZCW12302.CHC",USER="JMCGUAN",CD='MAR 29 15:44 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.5PT;">
	4
</FONT>
<A NAME="A2228031ZEX-99_1_HTM_23223-2-MM_PB_4_092750_5335">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="ARIAL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:5.0PT;">
	DEGOLYER AND MACNAUGHTON
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	For developed producing wells whose performance disclosed a reliable decline in producing-rate trends or other diagnostic characteristics, reserves were determined using decline-curve analysis. For producing wells whose performance was not yet established reserves were estimated using type curves. The parameters needed to develop these type curves, such as initial decline rate, b factor, and final decline rate, were based on nearby wells producing from the same reservoir and of similar completion for which more data were available. In the analyses of production-decline curves, reserves were estimated only to the limits of economic production or to the limit of the production licenses as appropriate. No additional wells are planned, so there are no undeveloped reserves.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	The rates used for future condensate, NGL, and gas production are estimated to be within the capacity of a well or reservoir to produce. Data available from wells drilled on the evaluated properties through December&nbsp;31, 2015, were used to prepare the estimates shown herein. Gross production through December&nbsp;31, 2015, was deducted from the gross ultimate recovery to arrive at estimates of gross reserves.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Gas quantities estimated herein are expressed as sales gas at a temperature base of 60 degrees Fahrenheit and a pressure base of the state in which the reserves are located. Sales gas is defined as the total gas to be produced from the reservoirs, measured at the point of delivery, after reduction for fuel usage, flare, and shrinkage resulting from field separation and processing. Condensate reserves estimated herein are those to be obtained by normal separator recovery. NGL reserves are those attributable to the leasehold interests according to processing agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Net reserves for the Trust&#146;s ownership of the ORRI are calculated at the aggregate level from the net revenue for each of the Lessees. To estimate net gas reserves, the total net revenue is divided by the net value of 1 thousand cubic feet (Mcf) of gas. The net value of 1 Mcf of gas is the gas price per Mcf, plus the condensate value per Mcf of gas, plus the NGL value per Mcf of gas. The net condensate and NGL reserves are calculated by multiplying their respective yields by the net gas reserves.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=4,EFW="2228031",CP="MESA ROYALTY TRUST",DN="4",CHK=438213,FOLIO='4',FILE="DISK104:[15ZCW2.15ZCW12302]23223-2-MM_ZCW12302.CHC",USER="JMCGUAN",CD='MAR 29 15:44 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage8"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.5PT;">
	5
</FONT>
<A NAME="A2228031ZEX-99_1_HTM_23223-2-MM_PB_5_092827_5796">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="ARIAL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:5.0PT;">
	DEGOLYER AND MACNAUGHTON
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Definition of Reserves
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Petroleum reserves included in this report are classified as proved. Only proved reserves have been evaluated for this report. Reserves classifications used in this report are in accordance with the reserves definitions of Rules&nbsp;4&#150;10(a)&nbsp;(1)&#150;(32) of Regulation S&#150;X of the SEC. Reserves are judged to be economically producible in future years from known reservoirs under existing economic and operating conditions and assuming continuation of current regulatory practices using conventional production methods and equipment. In the analyses of production-decline curves, reserves were estimated only to the limit of economic rates of production under existing economic and operating conditions using prices and costs consistent with the effective date of this report, including consideration of changes in existing prices provided only by contractual arrangements but not including escalations based upon future conditions. The petroleum reserves are classified as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .5IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Proved oil and gas reserves &#150;
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Proved oil and gas reserves are those quantities of oil and gas, which, by analysis of geoscience and engineering data, can be estimated with reasonable certainty to be economically producible&#150;from a given date forward, from known reservoirs, and under existing economic conditions, operating methods, and government regulations&#150;prior to the time at which contracts providing the right to operate expire, unless evidence indicates that renewal is reasonably certain, regardless of whether deterministic or probabilistic methods are used for the estimation. The project to extract the hydrocarbons must have commenced or the operator must be reasonably certain that it will commence the project within a reasonable time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .75IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	(i) The area of the reservoir considered as proved includes:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	(A)&nbsp;The area identified by drilling and limited by fluid contacts, if any, and (B)&nbsp;Adjacent undrilled portions of the reservoir that can, with reasonable certainty, be judged to be continuous with it and to contain economically producible oil or gas on the basis of available geoscience and engineering data.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	(ii) In the absence of data on fluid contacts, proved quantities in a reservoir are limited by the lowest known hydrocarbons
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(LKH)
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	as seen in a well penetration unless geoscience,
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=5,EFW="2228031",CP="MESA ROYALTY TRUST",DN="4",CHK=932884,FOLIO='5',FILE="DISK104:[15ZCW2.15ZCW12302]23223-2-MM_ZCW12302.CHC",USER="JMCGUAN",CD='MAR 29 15:44 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.5PT;">
	6
</FONT>
<A NAME="A2228031ZEX-99_1_HTM_23223-2-MM_PB_6_093058_2897">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="ARIAL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:5.0PT;">
	DEGOLYER AND MACNAUGHTON
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	engineering, or performance data and reliable technology establishes a lower contact with reasonable certainty.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT 0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	(iii) Where direct observation from well penetrations has defined a highest known oil (HKO) elevation and the potential exists for an associated gas cap, proved oil reserves may be assigned in the structurally higher portions of the reservoir only if geoscience, engineering, or performance data and reliable technology establish the higher contact with reasonable certainty.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT 0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	(iv) Reserves which can be produced economically through application of improved recovery techniques (including, but not limited to, fluid injection) are included in the proved classification when:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	(A)&nbsp;Successful testing by a pilot project in an area of the reservoir with properties no more favorable than in the reservoir as a whole, the operation of an installed program in the reservoir or an analogous reservoir, or other evidence using reliable technology establishes the reasonable certainty of the engineering analysis on which the project or program was based; and (B)&nbsp;The project has been approved for development by all necessary parties and entities, including governmental entities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT 0IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	(v) Existing economic conditions include prices and costs at which economic producibility from a reservoir is to be determined. The price shall be the average price during the 12-month period prior to the ending date of the period covered by the report, determined as an unweighted arithmetic average of the first-day-of-the-month price for each month within such period, unless prices are defined by contractual arrangements, excluding escalations based upon future conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Developed oil and gas reserves &#150;
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Developed oil and gas reserves are reserves of any category that can be expected to be recovered:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	(i)&nbsp;Through existing wells with existing equipment and operating methods or in which the cost of the required
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=6,EFW="2228031",CP="MESA ROYALTY TRUST",DN="4",CHK=959255,FOLIO='6',FILE="DISK104:[15ZCW2.15ZCW12302]23223-2-MM_ZCW12302.CHC",USER="JMCGUAN",CD='MAR 29 15:44 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.5PT;">
	7
</FONT>
<A NAME="A2228031ZEX-99_1_HTM_23223-2-MM_PB_7_093231_3020">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="ARIAL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:5.0PT;">
	DEGOLYER AND MACNAUGHTON
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	equipment is relatively minor compared to the cost of a new well; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	(ii)&nbsp;Through installed extraction equipment and infrastructure operational at the time of the reserves estimate if the extraction is by means not involving a well.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Undeveloped oil and gas reserves &#150;
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Undeveloped oil and gas reserves are reserves of any category that are expected to be recovered from new wells on undrilled acreage, or from existing wells where a relatively major expenditure is required for recompletion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	(i) Reserves on undrilled acreage shall be limited to those directly offsetting development spacing areas that are reasonably certain of production when drilled, unless evidence using reliable technology exists that establishes reasonable certainty of economic producibility at greater distances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	(ii) Undrilled locations can be classified as having undeveloped reserves only if a development plan has been adopted indicating that they are scheduled to be drilled within five years, unless the specific circumstances justify a longer time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	(iii) Under no circumstances shall estimates for undeveloped reserves be attributable to any acreage for which an application of fluid injection or other improved recovery technique is contemplated, unless such techniques have been proved effective by actual projects in the same reservoir or an analogous reservoir, as defined in [section 210.4&#150;10 (a)&nbsp;Definitions], or by other evidence using reliable technology establishing reasonable certainty.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=7,EFW="2228031",CP="MESA ROYALTY TRUST",DN="4",CHK=581427,FOLIO='7',FILE="DISK104:[15ZCW2.15ZCW12302]23223-2-MM_ZCW12302.CHC",USER="JMCGUAN",CD='MAR 29 15:44 2016' -->
<A NAME="eolPage11"></A>
<BR CLEAR="ALL" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS;">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.5PT;">
	8
</FONT>
<A NAME="A2228031ZEX-99_1_HTM_23223-2-MM_PB_8_093350_7748">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="ARIAL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:5.0PT;">
	DEGOLYER AND MACNAUGHTON
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Primary Economic Assumptions
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	This report has been prepared using initial prices and costs provided by or on behalf of Bank of New York. Future prices were estimated using guidelines established by the SEC and the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB). In this report, values for proved reserves were based on projections of estimated future production and revenue prepared for these properties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Revenue values in this report are estimated using the prices discussed herein. The following assumptions were used for estimating future prices and costs:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Condensate and NGL Prices
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Initial condensate and NGL prices were calculated using differentials furnished by the Lessees for their respective properties to West Texas Intermediate (WTI) Cushing price of $50.22 per barrel and held constant thereafter. The WTI Cushing price of $50.22 is the 12-month average price, calculated as the unweighted arithmetic average of the first-day-of-the-month price for each month within the 12-month period prior to the end of the reporting period. The volume-weighted average price over the lives of the properties was $40.53 per barrel for condensate and $16.03 per barrel for NGL.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Gas Prices
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Initial gas prices were calculated using differentials furnished by the Lessees for their respective properties to a Henry Hub price of $2.65 per million British thermal units and held constant thereafter. The Henry Hub price of $2.65 is the 12-month average price, calculated as the unweighted arithmetic average of the first-day-of-the-month price for each month within the 12-month period prior to the end of the reporting period. The volume-weighted average price over the lives of the properties was $2.61 per Mcf of gas.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<HR SIZE="3" WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="COLOR:#010101;">
</DIV>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.5PT;">
	9
</FONT>
<A NAME="A2228031ZEX-99_1_HTM_23223-2-MM_PB_9_093455_141">
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="ARIAL" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:5.0PT;">
	DEGOLYER AND MACNAUGHTON
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;">
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Operating Expenses and Capital Costs
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN .75IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Estimates of operating expenses based on current expenses were used for the life of each property with no increases in the future based on inflation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	While the oil and gas industry may be subject to regulatory changes from time to time that could affect an industry participant&#146;s ability to recover its oil and gas reserves, we are not aware of any such governmental actions which would restrict the recovery of the December&nbsp;31, 2015, estimated oil and gas reserves.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.5IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Estimates of the net proved reserves, as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, of the Trust&#146;s ownership in the ORRI are presented as follows. Condensate and NGL reserves are expressed in thousands of barrels (Mbbl) and gas reserves are expressed in millions of cubic feet (MMcf).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_26"></A>
<TABLE BORDER="0" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="93%" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;MARGIN-LEFT:.25IN;">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="25%" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0IN 0IN 0IN;WIDTH:25.0%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="1" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.0PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>

<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	In our opinion, the information relating to estimated proved reserves, estimated future net revenue from proved reserves, and present worth of estimated future net revenue from proved reserves of condensate, natural gas liquids, and gas contained in this report has been prepared in accordance with Paragraphs 932-235-50-4, 932-235-50-6, 932-235-50-7, 932-235-50-9, 932-235-50-30, and 932-235-50-31(a), (b), and (e)&nbsp;of the Accounting Standards Update 932-235-50,
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Extractive Industries &#150; Oil and Gas (Topic 932): Oil and Gas Reserve Estimation and Disclosures
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	(January&nbsp;2010) of the Financial Accounting Standards Board and Rules&nbsp;4&#150;10(a)&nbsp;(1)&#150;(32) of Regulation S&#150;X and Rules&nbsp;302(b), 1201, and 1202(a)&nbsp;(1), (2), (3), (4), (8)&nbsp;of Regulation S&#150;K of the Securities and Exchange Commission; provided, however, (i)&nbsp;future income tax expenses have not been taken into account in estimating the future net revenue and present worth values set forth herein and (ii)&nbsp;estimates of the proved developed and proved undeveloped reserves are not presented at the beginning of the year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

	To the extent the above-enumerated rules, regulations, and statements require determinations of an accounting or legal nature, we, as engineers, are necessarily unable to express an opinion as to whether the above-described information is in accordance therewith or sufficient therefor.
</FONT>

</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

</FONT>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT SIZE="3" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.5PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CERTIFICATE of QUALIFICATION
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	I, Paul J. Szatkowski, Petroleum Engineer with DeGolyer and MacNaughton, 5001 Spring Valley Road, Suite&nbsp;800 East, Dallas, Texas, 75244 U.S.A., hereby certify:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	1.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	That I am a Senior Vice President with DeGolyer and MacNaughton, which company did prepare the letter report addressed to Mesa Royalty Trust dated February&nbsp;22, 2016, and that I, as Senior Vice President, was responsible for the preparation of this letter report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT .5IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN;">
<FONT SIZE="2" FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	2.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="1" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:3.0PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE="2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	That I attended Texas A&amp;M University, and that I graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree in Petroleum Engineering in the year 1974; that I am a Registered Professional Engineer in the State of Texas; that I am a member of the International Society of Petroleum Engineers and the American Association of Petroleum Geologists; and that I have in excess of 40 years of experience in oil and gas reservoir studies and reserves evaluations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:16.0PT;MARGIN:0IN 0IN .0001PT;">
